description: Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC), on behalf of the department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada, is issuing this request for proposal (RFP) to perform important electrical work located at in Mont-Joli (Sainte-Flavie), Quebec, as detailed in Annex A.
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

* **Contract Title** : EF997-232192, Electrical Compliance Work at the Institute Maurice Lamontagne in Mont-Joli
* **Reference Number** : WS4025955769-Doc4025958338
* **Tender Amendment Number** : 2
* **Publication Date** : June 2, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date** : July 18, 2023 14:00 hours
* **Contract Type** : Request for Proposal - Competitive and Open Bidding
* **Service Code** : UNSPSC 72151500, Electrical System Services
* **Procurement Category** : CNST

### Tender Details

The Department of Public Works and Government Services of Canada (PWGSC) invites tenders from qualified contractors for electrical compliance work at the Institute Maurice Lamontagne in Mont-Joli (Sainte-Flavie), Quebec.

The contract objective is to perform electrical infrastructure work in accordance with the specifications outlined in Annex A. The successful tenderer will be responsible for executing the project in conformity with Health and Safety regulations and the terms of the contract.

### Evaluation Criteria

Tenders will be evaluated based on the lowest price received. The following documents are part of the tender package:

* Request for Proposal document;
* Annex A: Specifications;

### Contact Information

For any inquiries or clarification, please contact:
* **Marie-Claude Dugal**        
PWGSC - Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada
 Phone: * ( Not provided )
Email: [marie-claude.dugal@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:marie-claude.dugal@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
Website: [discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16471394](http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16471394?extsite=MTY0NzEzOTRfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==)

### Other Information

The tender is open to all qualified contractors who meet the requirements. The successful contractor is expected to start work on July 4, 2023.
